metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18313 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Perl before 5.26.3 has a buffer over-read via a crafted regular expressionthat triggers disclosure of sensitive information from process memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libperl5.22 - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl-base - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl-debug - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
perl-modules-5.22 - 5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: perl package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.22.1-9ubuntu0.6').
